abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Emergency
            Demobilization, Reinsertion and Reintegration Program are to
            demobilize combatants, and support their transition, and
            reinsertion to civilian life, while in addition, contribute
            to the reallocation of Government expenditure from defense,
            to social and economic sectors. The Project includes a quick
            disbursing mechanism that uses a positive list of imports to
            generate counterpart funds in order to finance rapid Program
            implementation. Not only will the program benefit returning
            ex-combatants and militia to productive civilian
            livelihoods, but a secondary benefit will be the increased
            allocation of public resources towards poverty reduction.
            Nonetheless, the resumption of hostilities remains the major
            external risk, while Program specific risks, are largely
            linked to weak implementation capacity.
